etymologies: late 17th century: Scots variant of Scots and northern English scalp ‘mussel bed’, a feeding ground of the duck

definitions: a Eurasian, North American, and New Zealand diving duck, the male of which has a black head with a green or purple gloss.

notes.text: Genus Aythya, family Anatidae: three species, in particular the widespread A. marila, with a black breast and white sides
